snippet: The question of Tom Brady’s and Bill Belichick’s collective legacy gets tricky, even for two men certain to reach the Hall of Fame, after a second straight Super Bowl loss to the Giants.
abstract: Greg Bishop On Pro Football column suggests that the joint legacy of New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick and quarterback Tom Brady, two men who are certain to reach the Hall of Fame, gets trickier after a second straight Super Bowl loss to the New York Giants.
lead_paragraph: The question of Tom Brady’s and Bill Belichick’s collective legacy gets tricky, even for two men certain to reach the Hall of Fame, after a second straight Super Bowl loss to the Giants.

headline.seo: Falling Short Again, Legacy of Belichick and Brady Loses Some Luster
headline.main: By Smallest of Margins, a Patriots Legacy Is Being Redefined
headline.print_headline: By Smallest Margins, A Patriots Legacy Is Being Redefined
